steps.title: Take out your regular battery and regular memory stick.
steps.content: Take out your regular battery and regular memory stick.

steps.title: Insert your Pandora Battery.
steps.content: Insert your Pandora Battery. Your PSP should turn itself on. Depending on what's on the magic memory stick, you will see a menu.

steps.title: Click "install X.XX M33" or "install original X.XX".
steps.content: Click "install X.XX M33" or "install original X.XX". it doesn't matter which option you pick.

steps.title: Your PSP screen will say "Flashing file ..."
steps.content: Your PSP screen will say "Flashing file ..." about a hundred times. The magic memory stick is putting files on your PSP to make it work properly.

steps.title: Just wait a minute or two.
steps.content: Just wait a minute or two.

steps.title: You will see the text, "Install complete.
steps.content: You will see the text, "Install complete. Press X to shutdown the PSP". Simply press X. Your PSP will turn off.

steps.title: Insert your regular battery and regular memory stick
steps.content: Insert your regular battery and regular memory stick

steps.title: If you installed X.XX M33, hold the R trigger and turn on your PSP.
steps.content: If you installed X.XX M33, hold the R trigger and turn on your PSP. If you installed original X.XX, stop here, your PSP is unbricked.

steps.title: You will see a menu.
steps.content: You will see a menu. This is called the Recovery Menu. Select "Advanced ->" and press X.

steps.title: Select "Format flash1 and reset settings".
steps.content: Select "Format flash1 and reset settings". Your PSP will restart. You will see a blue screen with several languages. In each language, the message is "Setting Information is corrupted. Press O to restore default settings".

steps.title: Your PSP should start up like brand new.
steps.content: Your PSP should start up like brand new. Congratulations, your PSP is unbricked.
